defs: = ಅನುಭವಜನ್ಯ.
that which is emanated from or caused by, experience.
a public platform by the 12th century reformer Basava in the city Kalyāṇa, for discussing the religious and social principles.
knowable only by means of experience.
a man having had much experience, as in a particular occupation or activity.
a man having learned from experience and hence is wise and competent.
having experience in a particular activity.
= ಅನುಭವಶಾಲಿ.
the state or fact of having experience and, hence having wisdom.
knowable only by means of experience.
that which is knowable only by means of experience.
based on observation or experience; empirical.
quality of being based on observation or experience; empiricism.
established from experience.
a person experienced (the real) happiness.
= ಅನುಭವಶಾಲಿ.
a woman having had much experience, as in a particular occupation or activity.
a woman having learned from experience and hence is wise and competent.
of or subject to experience; knowable by means of experience.
practical (as opp. to theoretical).
the state of fact or a property being in possession of its owner himself or herself.
empirical i.e. a) relying or based solely on experiment and observation rather than theory.
relying or based on practical experience without reference to scientific principles.
(phil.) the theory that sense experience is the only source of knowledge; empiricism.
a follower or an advocate of the theory of empiricism; empiricist.
= ಅನುಭವಶಾಲಿ; 3) a person initiated into esoteric mysteries; a follower of mystical way of life; a mystic.
= ಅನುಭವಶಾಲಿ.
to have experience of; to personally encounter or feel; to meet with; undergo; to experience.
to enjoy i.e. a) to have or experience with joy; to get pleasure from; relish; b) to have the use or benefit of; to have as one's lot or advantage.
to undergo (something painful or unpleasant, as injury, grief, a loss, etc.); to be afflicted with.
= ಅನುಭವಾರೂಢ.
= ಅನುಭವಾರೂಢವಾದ.
= ಅನುಭವಾರೂಢವಾದಿ.
(Jain.) the Power that ordains the award for the soul for its deeds.
the experience of the soul being one with the Supreme; mystic experience.
(dance) the consequent mood which, in totality, helps the main thematic mod develop and be depicted well.
a nan having mystical experience; a mystic.
a seminar or series of meetings for intensive study, work, discussion, etc. in the field of Vīraśaiva philosophy or religion; Vīraśaiva workshop.
= ಅನುಭವಮಂಟಪ.
the discussions, deliberations carried on therein.
a higher stage of devotion to the God, in which the devotee enjoys the feeling of the Goḍs presence or proximity.
that branch of knowledge or study of mysticism esp. one concerned with establishing and systematizing principles, and methods, as by experiments and hypotheses.
a person having had much experience, as in a particular occupation or activity.
a person having or capable of having, esoteric or mystic experience; a mystic.
(juris.) a) a person who sees or has seen something happen, as an accident, crime, etc.; b) an eye-witness i.e.- a person who testifies to what he or she has seen.
to think deeply about; to ponder over; to analyse mentally.
a speech or an argument in favour of the subject matter.
a speaker that argues in favour of the subject matter.
enjoyed; relished; had the benefit of.
enjoyed; relished; had the benefit of.
experience; perceived; felt.
of, relating to or existed or taken place in, the time that is over; past; of a former time; bygone.
ಅನುಭೂತಂ ಮಾಡು anubhūtam mādu to bear or put up with; to endure; to tolerate; ಅನುಭೂತವಾಗು anubhūtavāgu to be experienced; to become experienced.
the moment gone by; a moment previous to the present one.
the experience one had in the past; past experience.
the experience of mystical union or direct communion with ultimate reality reported by mystics.
practical experience without reference to scientific principles, mystical or theoretical experience.
that part of mental faculty which can have conception or impression of something known, experienced or imagined; notion.

empathy - a) the projection of one's own personality into the personality of another in order to understand the person better; ability to share in another's emotions, thoughts or feelings; b) the projection of one's own personality into an object, with the attribution to the object of one's own emotions, responses, etc.
ordained to be experienced or undergone.
that which is ought to be experienced or undergone.
(masc.) one who enjoys or experiences.
(masc.) a person who buys goods and services for personal needs and not for resale or to use in the production of other goods for resale; a consumer.
the experience of sorrow and joy; a living through suffering and enjoyment.
the condition of being under one's ownership or possession.
a gift of a property or fund as a reward for the service; an endowment.
a right or privilege that a person may have in another's land, as the right of way; easement.
(econ.) the using up of goods or services, either by consumers or in the production of other goods; consumption.
a man who enjoys the benefit from or the possession of (a property etc.); an occupier.
one who has experience.
one who has legal entitlement for using and enjoying.
a person who is in possession of some thing (as an asset etc.).
to have or experience with joy; to get pleasure from; to relish.
to have the use or benefit of; to have as one's lot or advantage.
to undergo sufferings.
(mus.) the gravest octave.
the very soft, vascular, fatty tissue that fills the cavities of most bones; soft marrow.
accepted; agreed; consented; permitted.
= ಅನುಮತಿ - 1.
a favourable disposition or bent of mind; liking; preference.

opinion - a) a belief not based on absolute certainty or positive knowledge but on what seems true, valid or probable to one's own mind; judgment; b) an evaluation, impression or estimation of the quality or worth of a person or thing; c) the formal judgment of an expert on a matter in which advice is sought.
a command, direction or instruction, usu. backed by authority.
formal consent; approval; licence; permission.
the moon as seen on the fourteenth day of the first fortnight of the lunar month; and that night.

(Jain.) a head of a family, who, in pursuance of religious realisations, has abandoned, in favour of his children, his duties and responsibilities towards the family, and lives like a guest in his own house.
to consent - a) to agree (to do something); b) to give permission, approval or assent (to something proposed or requested) in opinion.
to cause to agree or give permission, approval or assent.
=ಅನುಮಾನ - 3.
act of holding back in doubt or indecision; hesitation.
a woman's burning herself with her husband's dead body; self-immolation of a woman following the death of her husband.
the section of the brain behind and below the cerebrum, consisting of two lateral lobes and a middle lobe, and functions as the coordinating centre for muscular movement; the cerebellum.
to cause to make ready; to get something ready.
to make ready, usu. for a specific purpose; make suitable.
to get oneself prepared; to be ready.
an inferring, theorising or predicting from incomplete or uncertain evidence; guesswork; conjecturing.
an inference, theory or prediction based on guesswork; guess; a conjecture.
a way or method in which something is done or happens or must happen or be done; mode or fashion of procedure; manner.
a condition of uncertainty; a doubt.
the act or an instance of suspecting guilt, a wrong, harmfulness, etc. with little or no supporting evidence and the feeling or state of the mind of a person who suspects.
(rhet.) a fig. of speech which consists in a notion, expressed in a peculiarly striking manner, of a thing established by a proof.

ಅನುಮಾನದ ಲಾಭ anumānada lābha assumption of a person's innocence, rightness, faultlessness, etc., rather than the contrary in the absence of proof; benefit of the doubt; ಅನುಮಾನವೇ ದೊಡ್ಡ ರೋಗ anumānavē doḍḍa rōga (prov.) lack of trust or certainty is the source of failure.
= ಅನುಮಾನಪಡು.
to doubt - a) to be uncertain in opinion or belief; to be undecided; b) to be inclined to disbelief.
to suspect - a) to believe to be bad, wrong, harmful, questionable, etc.; b) to think it probable or likely; to guess; to surmise; to suppose.
proving or knowing a fact by logical inference, one of the three kinds of corroboration of facts.
(rhet.) a fig. of speech which consists in a notion, expressed in a peculiarly striking manner, of a thing established by a proof.
arousing or likely to arouse suspicion; suspicious.
derived by reasoning; concluded or judged from premises or evidence.
guessed, speculated, surmised.
to conclude or decide from something known or assumed; derive by reasoning; draw as a conclusion.
to stop because of indecision; to pause or delay in acting; to hesitate.
to make a mental image of; to form an idea or notion of; to conceive in the mind; to create by the imagination.
correct reasoning; valid induction or deduction; logic.
a measuring of the strength of a solution by finding how much of another solution of known strength is required to complete a chemical reaction; titration.

to find out how much of a certain substance is contained in a known volume of a solution by measuring volumetrically how much of a standard solution is required to produce a given reaction; to titrate.
a long-established custom or practice that has the effect of an unwritten law; a tradition.
a following of a long established custom or practice, a tradition; and the manner in which it is done.
arrived at or proposed by conjecture; guessed; conjectured; deduced; inferred.
an inference or deduction.
a proposition that follows from another that has been proved; a corollary.
that which is inferred; a conclusion or opinion arrived at by inferring; an inference; a deduction.
an act or the process of inferring.
to conclude or decide from something known or assumed; to derive by reasoning; to draw as a conclusion; to infer; to deduce.
to be inclined to disbelief; to doubt; to hold back in doubt, indecision or with lack of certainty or confidence; to hesitate.
to make a mental image of; to form an idea or notion of; to conceive in the mind; to suppose; to guess.
to impress upon the mind; to inculcate; to teach.
to cause to be, come or happen faster; to hasten.
that which is or can be, known by inference.
to derive by reasoning; to conclude or judge from premises or evidence; to infer.
= ಅನುಮೇಯಿಸು.
great joy or pleasure; delight; pleasure.
an agreement in opinion or sentiment; consent.
a man who consents.
he who seconds other person's opinion, view, motion or a bill or the candidature of another.
a woman who consents.
she who seconds other person's opinion, view, motion or a bill or candidature.
= ಅನುಮೋದನೆ.
the virtuous merit gained by supporting or seconding otheṛs good work.
act of causing or providing delight to gladness to other.
act of making another believe.
an agreement of another's opinion; a consent; an approval.
delight got from sympathy.
to give consent to.
= ಅನುಮೋದನೆಕೊಡು.
= ಅನುಮೋದನಪುಣ್ಯ.
the virtuous merit or sinful demerit gained by supporting or seconding otheṛs good or sinful work.
tending to delight or to cause gladness to another.
delighted by sympathy received.
= ಅನುಮೋದಕ.
one who is delighted by sympathy received.
accepted; agreed; consented; permitted; approved.
supported; seconded.
to accept; to agree; to consent; to approve.
to second; to support.
followed closely or sincerely.
a body of assistants, followers or servants attending a person of rank or importance; train of attendants; a retinue.
a follower - a) a person that follows another behind; b) a person who follows another's beliefs, teachings or discipline (as, philosophy, religious faith etc.).
an interrogating or being interrogated; examination; enquiring.
an act of accusing of wrong doing.
act of causing to undergo pain, loss or suffering for a crime or wrong doing; punishing.
a seeking of advice; a listening to counsel.
religious meditation; meditation on the principle of Supreme.
(Jain.) the scriptures (collectively) that contains the teachings of various thīrthaŋkaras.
= ಅನುಯೋಗ - 1.
the act of joining, tying or linking together; connection.
(ling.) adaptation of the original roots of words into the present form.
to join or fasten (two things together.
to relate; to connect or associate, as in thought or meaning; show as having to do with; to show a relation between.
a man strongly devoted to or intensely liking something or someone; a devotee.
a man who loves strongly someone or something; a lover.
to cause, influence to love.

the attractive force, of varying strength for various elements, that causes the atoms of certain elements to combine and stay combined .
intense love.
strong devotion.
to have, show, convey one's strong desire or love (for someone or something).
a woman strongly devoted to or intensely liking something or someone; a devotee.
a woman who loves strongly someone or something; a lover.
a resonating body or device, as for increasing sonority or for analysing sound; a resonator.
reinforcement and prolongation of a sound or musical tone by reflection or by sympathetic vibration of other bodies; resonance.
(rhet.) (in poetical compositions) the figurative expression (sound) that resonants or resounds following the common meaning of the word.
resounded resonantly.
ಅನುರಣಿತವಾಗು anuraṇitavāgu (sound) to produced resonantly.
the resonant sound; the echo.
to resound; to vibrate sympathetically.
a deep, intense and tender feeling of affection for or attachment or devotion to a person (also to a thing); love.
the red colour.
the quality of being red in colour.
to have a strong liking or intense love.
to feel love for.
to delight in; to take pleasure in.
to have love for.
to feel love for.

a letter written expressing one's love for another with whom he or she has romantic relationship; a love-letter.
the sentiment of love; the delight of that sentiment.
one who loves or strongly likes.
a strongly devoted man; a devotee.
one who is loved or liked (as in comp. ಜನಾನುರಾಗಿ)
to love; to feel love for.
a loving or beloved woman.
a bright star in the constellation Scorpio; the seventeenth star in the list of twenty seven star, in Indian astrology.
corresponding in structure, position, character, quality, etc.; similar or identical; homologous 2) composed of similar or identical elements or parts; uniform.
matching in all respects; suitable.
fitting in properly; compatible.

proper, right or suitable manner.
the state or condition of being the same in quality, character, power, value, rank, etc.; parity.
resemblance; similarity.
the condition or fact of being in harmony or agreement; conformity.
homologous - a) corresponding in structure, position, character, etc; b) (biol.) corresponding in basic type of structure and deriving from a common primitive origin.
that which is homologous to something else, as maṇs arms, a whales flipper, a birḍs wings; homologue.
an act of obliging or accommodating; adjusting oneself to otheṛs nature or compulsion.
an act of compelling or being compelled; coercion; duress; compulsion.

giving attention to; attentive in observing or perceiving.

act of rubbing oil or ointment on; anointment.
an oily substance or medicinal ointment applied to the skin for healing or cosmetic purposes; salve; unguent.

any substance so applied.
= ಅನುಲೇಪ.

to rub, smear or apply oil or ointment on the skin for cosmetic or healing purpose.
an established, accepted order; the order in vogue.
(mus.) the natural or original pace of time kept as a base (first tempo, on which the second and third one are based in the ratio 1:2:4).
the caste of an offspring of a man of higher caste and a woman of lower caste.
a marriage of a man of higher caste with a woman of lower caste.
a man who follows, abides by, adheres to, the established and accepted code of conduct or order.
inviolable - a) not to be violated; not to be profaned or injured; sacred; b) that cannot be violated; indestructible.
the condition or state of being inviolable; inviolability.

to restrict; to retrain - a) to hold back from action; check; suppress; curb; b) to keep under control.
to express dissent or objection, in strong words.
descent; lineage; ancestry.
a list of ancestors; record of ancestry; family tree.

mentalist, the theory of heredity as formulated by Gregor Mendel, i.e. a) the principle stating that during the production of gametes the two copies of each hereditary factor segregate so that offspring acquire one factor from each parent; law of segregation; b) the principle stating that the laws of chance govern which particular characteristics of the parental pairs will occur in each individual offspring; law of independent assortment; c) the principle stating that one factor in a pair of traits dominates the other in inheritance unless both factors in the pair are recessive; law of dominance.
a person who accepts or advocates the theory that heredity is of overriding importance in determining individual characteristics; herediatarian.

hereditary - a) of or passed down by, inheritance from an ancestor to a legal heir; ancestral b) having title, right, etc. by inheritance; c) of or passed down by, heredity; designating or of a characteristic transmitted genetically from generation to generation.

heredity - a) the transmission of characteristics from parent to offspring by means of genes in the chromosomes; b) the tendency of offspring to resemble parents or ancestors through such transmission.
to bring to the acceptable level of quality, form or size; to make ready or useable.
to be set right; to be put back in good order, condition; to be regularised; to be provided with required facilities.
one's face brought close to another's face, both standing one against the other.
a kind of kiss, in which the tongues of both persons touch each otheṛs and ones lips pressing otheṛs tightly.
to utter as told; to repeat another's words.
to explain the meaning of; to make understandable; to bring out the meaning of.
to talk to; to have a dialogue.
to give an account of; to narrate.
to put into the words of a different language without changing the meaning, intention or purport.

the afflicted condition; suffering; affliction.

a) to follow behind; b) to follow the ideas, opinions, etc. of.

an explaining in understandable terms; a detailed interpretation.
to explain the meaning of; to make understandable; to bring out the meaning of;

something that impedes progress or achievement; an obstacle.

obeying or willing to obey; submissive; able to be make follow obediently; obedient.
(psych.) reacting or readily or without resistance to suggestion or appeal; responsive.
the nature or habit of obeying submissively; obedience.

the act of following another's instructions, suggestions or will; obedience.
the act of conveying one's approval, agreement.
anything brought about by a cause or agent; result; effect.
(gram.) application of an aphorism to subsequent stanzas, paragraphs or chapter; a common application of a rule.

behaviour - i.e. a) the way a person behaves or acts; conduct; manners; b) (psych.) an organism's responses to stimulation or environment, esp. those responses that can be observed; c) an instance of such a behaviour esp. one of a recurring or characteristic pattern of observable actions or responses.
(psych.) act of adapting oneself to or acting according to circumstances; adaptation.
responding to.
reciprocally related.
(two complex numbers) having their real parts equal and their imaginary parts equal but of opposite signs; conjugate.

to follow faithfully; to be obedient or submissive.
to do; to accomplish; to complete.

being under another's control; having or showing a tendency to submit without resistance; obedient; submissive.
a man who is under the control of or is subservient to, another.
a woman who is under the control of or is subservient to, another.

degeneration of the organs of the body.

a verbatim repetition of the other has uttered.

agreement; consent; approval.
to translate into another language.

sympathy - a) sameness of feeling; affinity between persons or of one person for another; b) a relation between body parts of such a nature that a disorder, pain, etc. in one induces a similar effect in another.
